attributes.action: Surrey County Council must abandon plans to switch off street lights at night.
attributes.background: SCC plan to switch off thousands of street lights at night, to save around £210,000 a year. This comparatively small amount could easily be saved by measures such as reducing consultant use or abolishing the Chief Exec post, and prevent potential safety and crime issues.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local street lighting is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:

https://petitions.surreycc.gov.uk/
